website_summaries.verdict: They are reversible, look good, have a rugged build, and come at a surprisingly low price — you get a great deal without scrimping on quality.
pros: These rustic steps look great and can hold up to 300 pounds
Made of heavy-duty resin, they are easy to assemble and slip resistant
Works with both square sided and round sided hot tubs
cons: They are somewhat basic, but you'll find few complaints about these well-made steps

customer_reviews.title: To help with assembly....
customer_reviews.text: I've read all the reviews about how hard these spa steps are to assemble so I figured I should write a review to show how I did it to help others who decide to buy. Once I did figured it out (which did take some time) it was simple... First start with the bottom step for stability. Insert the back of the step (as shown in the pic) then step on the front. Snaps right in. Then do the same with the top step. Took me less than five minutes on my own (no help). Hope this helps😊
customer_reviews.author: maggiemea

customer_reviews.title: Some people are saying that the curved edge leaves a ...
customer_reviews.text: Some people are saying that the curved edge leaves a gap between the hot tub and the step. These people are putting the steps together wrong. You can put this together with either a curved edge or a straight edge on top. Since my hot tub has a straightedge, I placed a straight edge on the top step as the directions say. If your hot tub has a curved edge, you place the curved step on top. These are definitely rugged steps. I had to jump on the step to get it to snap into place.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie R. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy (holds 350lbs)
customer_reviews.text: We built a new deck around our pool. Pool Deck was a little shorter than pool so we needed just a few steps. I wanted no maintenance and sturdy steps. After reading several reviews I purchased these gray steps to match my pool. I couldn’t have been happier with my decision! Holds up to 350 lbs very sturdy and to my surprise they came with nonslip pads to stick to bottom!!! After reading the reviews on how hard they were to assemble someone stated they had someone stand on them. I had my daughter step on them to lock them in to place done from opening box to assembled in 5 mins
customer_reviews.author: Cutn Queen

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick- seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a snap- literally. Instructions show you how to assemble it for use against a flat spot wall or a rounded hot tub. We accidentally got a step reversed but with a simple screwdriver popped it out put around and snapped it back into place the right way. Durable plastic resin seems to hold up well. The instructions show you how to assemble it for use against a flat spa wall or a rounded hot tub. We accidentally got a step reversed but with a simple screwdriver popped it out put around and snapped it back into place the right way. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Ive had this now 4 straight years and just got around to reviewing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stairs in 2013. It is still going strong. No problems even been through 4 now Cleveland winters. The snow comes right off (doesnt stick to it.) It is sturdy. It shows absolutely NO signs of wear after 4 years. I remember thinking when I bought this. "This is an expensive stairs" It is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JXD

customer_reviews.title: STURDY & DURABLE STEPS THAT HELP KEEP MY POOL SAFE
customer_reviews.text: GREAT-LOOKING, STURDY & DURABLE STEPS THAT HELP KEEP MY POOL SAFE!!! HAD ONE SET FOR ENTRY AND NOW A SECOND SET FOR EXIT.... VERY SMOOTH, ROUNDED EDGES AND SURFACES THAT POSE ZERO THREAT TO THE VINYL LINER INSIDE THE POOL!!! AND I WEIGH JUST UNDER 350 LBS!!! I TRUST CONFER STEPS & LADDERS FOR KEEPING MY FAMILY SAFE AROUND OUR POOL & SPA!!!
customer_reviews.author: Major Maury Lynk, USAF (RET)

customer_reviews.title: Very nice material and color
customer_reviews.text: Very nice material and color. Assembling is a little tricky. I tried using a mallet, but it did not help. But, when I rubbed a little dishwashing soap on each corner going into main frame, and my husband stomped hard on the step being placed, it finally snapped in place. So, be patient, but it is a strong and good looking step. Be sure to see instructions printed on the box regarding which step goes on top depending on the shape of your hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: My take...

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly and Study
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about these steps is that they are slip-proof! That is a big deal when you're exiting a spa. You don't want to slip and fall with wet feet. The second best thing is they are light and airy so mold and mildew don't build up on them. There's no little asphalt bits to melt and fall off like my last set of steps. I live in South Texas. My back yard gets super hot in the summer. So far, these steps are holding up to that melting heat. Assembly took exactly 3 minutes! And they are study enough to hold a large person's weight.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy W. Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Stable, solid feeling and large
customer_reviews.text: This a sturdy, large spa step. I use it to get into bed. It feels stable and solid. It is large, but I wanted that rather than a skinny step I have to navigate. Like others have said, it does take a few strong stomps during assembly to "lock" the steps in. Maybe that is why it feels so stable. It is not a featherweight, but it is light enough that I can move it around the house as needed for other uses, and I feel a lot safer on this than I do on a step ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Moccasin

customer_reviews.title: Great value - not that difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive to purchase these plastic stairs based on the reviews describing assembly difficulty. The outside of the box had large drawings showing how to assemble. I followed them, first inserting the middle stairs at a 45 degree angle, making sure the left and right protruding tab fit inside the concave receptacle, before pushing down and stepping on the stair, forcing it to "snap" into place. Followed that same procedure for the top stair and complete assemble in less than 2 minutes. The key is using your weight to snap the stairs into place, rather than pounding with a rubber mallet. I am happy with the product and how sturdy the stairs are.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed with this step
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this step. It's very flimsy and the steps bow when someone stands on it (even my three year old son). I feel like it's going to snap in half at any minute. Also, the dimensions are not correct at all. We have a very small area for these steps to fit and they barely fit, they don't look how I thought they would at all. Spend a little more money and get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Deserves more stars than 5
customer_reviews.text: I received my order one full day ahead of schedule and couldn’t be happier. It took less than 5 minutes to assemble. No hammer needed, just a well placed hard stomp and they snap together. I know that people wondered if this would be a good solution for RV steps. These steps fit that bill exactly. Sturdy, attractive and should last a lifetime. I really like the option of straight or curved top step. I whole heartedly endorse this product and it’s made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: G Man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Step
customer_reviews.text: This item is great with our round spa. It really helps for entering and leaving the spa. It was a bit of a challenge assembling. We used a rubber mallet and a board in-between to force the step into place. It is very sturdy and easy to clean. I recommend this item to anyone needing a very sturdy step. The additional plus is that if fits round or straight edge spas.
customer_reviews.author: mrstorage

customer_reviews.title: Use for camper steps and love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these steps to use with our travel trailer. Sometimes when leveling at a site you have a bigger gap beneath your step that makes a second step imperative. This has been a wonderful solution that's perfectly sturdy! We use it every time instead of pulling out our camper step - it fits right under the door and while traveling it wedges underneath our camper table perfectly. It also makes for a handy seat when in use. Best purchase ever. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Overall good value
customer_reviews.text: The steps are ok..they were somewhat difficult to assemble..I had lined them up and took a rubber mallet to assist with snapping them into place when just regular hand pressure wouldn't work and even the mallet was unsuccessful..it wasn't until I actually got so frustrated that I stomped on them that they actually snapped together..however this was a bit of a risky maneuver when the steps were wobbly and unstable..I have put together Lil Tikes playhouses for my daughters that were made of like materials easier than this! Bit once I won the battle the steps appear to be sturdy and of use. Definitely a better price than comparable steps I viewed in Spa and Pool stores!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the steps for our new hot tub. Hot tub not here yet but the steps are very nice. They went together easily and are very sturdy. I like that they are quite wide and the steps are deep so slipping should not be a problem. They also have four rubber stick-ons for the bottom so the steps shouldn’t slide either. Directions were all in foreign languages (no English) but the pictures were easy to follow. I almost missed the stick-ons in the bottom of the box as the pictures didn’t reflect those. I’m impressed by the steps enough, I am not lowering the star rating for the negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was no problem
customer_reviews.text: After reading many of the reviews about assembling these steps we had no trouble putting them together. We were disappointed that it did NOT come with instructions so the reviews were extremely helpful. Great advice about inserting the lower step first and snapping the back in first. My husband just stepped on the front and it went in place with no problem! The steps look great!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Fabricius

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but dangerous for kids due to curved edge
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy but one issue...it has a slight curve where it should be flush against the hot tub. My 3yr old niece's foot got caught and she fell. Luckily she wasn't hurt badly.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa L. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Works with RV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to access our rv and it works PERFECTLY. I have MS and the auto step to the inside step was difficult for me. This is sturdy so I feel stable and the auto step comes out and is hidden underneath. I recommend this to RVers. Take measurements first to make sure it will work for you. Only downside is it takes up space in storage but well worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Debra McLendon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for 32" Tall Round Hot Tub
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, but very sturdy with a 300 lbs load capacity. Nice to have the option to use the curved step in top slot for a round hot tub. Have had the steps in full sun for a month and does not appear to have faded at all. Seems to reflect heat too as they don't get too hot. Also, nice non-slip texture, though they do tend to hold some water after stepping out of the tub. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Explorer76

customer_reviews.title: Worked without high cost
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the assembly . There are not a lot of pieces but what makes it hard is pounding the steps into place. If I did not have a husband I could not have used this. He had a hard time with a rubber mallet and brut force. The work fine but if you are upper over weight I imagine they would not last as long. They are sturdy just not like wood.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: One curved and one straight step
customer_reviews.text: Was a little bit difficult to get the pieces together, as other reviews have said, but works great. Wish I had noticed that one step is curved for round tubs and the other is straight for rectangular tubs before I assembled it, but so be it...no way it'll come apart easily. The ridges in the steps collect rain water, but the assembly is light weight so easy to tip on one end and drain the water. Sure beats having to maintain a wooden step!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER H LYNT

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected, large and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and larger then expected. Don’t kid yourself, its not easy snapping the steps into place. You really have to stomp on the end piece to get it to set. If I was over 60, might be tough to assemble. Givin that I was able to set the steps rather easily, and its apperance. It gets 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shulman

customer_reviews.title: Versatile steps:  Can fit rounded edge or flat edge tubs
customer_reviews.text: Very durable plastic that will last in extreme temperatures (heat and cold). The steps snap very quickly. If your tub is rounded, you simply snap the step that has a rounded edge facing the tub. If your tub is squared, you simple snap the flat edge facing the tub. The steps can be re-adjusted based on what kind of tub you have. If you examine the picture, you can see how each step has a different edge, one rounded and one flat. Simply turn it to the edge you need and snap it in. The price was great! I would order this again if I needed a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: FREQNTAMZNBUYR77

customer_reviews.title: Great universal hot tub step
customer_reviews.text: This hot tub step is a universal style that is useful for many styles of hot tubs. The step makes it easy to get in and out of our hot tub. It was easy to assemble and is well made. Pros: Simple to unbox and put together, looks great, classic style, weatherproof and durable. Cons: Not real wood, needs to be placed on a flat stable surface, some of the grooves can collect dirt. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Andy & Katie Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy steps
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers have alluded to, you have to pound the living daylights out of the steps to connect them to the base pieces. But once you do that, this is a sturdy set of hot tub steps! Priced right, too -- have seen others at local hot tub stores for double and triple this price.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great quality steps
customer_reviews.text: These steps came quickly and in good shape. It does take a little force to get them snapped together, but once you get them in place, they stay. Been using them this winter on the hottub and really like them. The steps still have plenty of traction even when covered in snow so you dont have to worry about slipping. Great product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B

customer_reviews.title: Great universal and sturdy Hot Tub steps.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy product and extremely easy to snap together. When I first ordered I was wondering if I had to select the “rounded” stair set or the “straight” stairs. It turns out they are universal. If you have a rounded tub the round step is install at the top. The included straight step is installed on the bottom. If you a square tub you you install the square step at the top and rounded step at the bottom. They hold lots of weight and adults can feel secure on these two wide steps.
customer_reviews.author: frequentbuyer

customer_reviews.title: The material, size, sturdiness and quality of these steps are great!
customer_reviews.text: We needed steps to get into our new tornado shelter in the side of the hill. My husband dug out a spot so they would be level and put the dirt and rocks back around them. Because it said that the sun won’t hurt or disintegrate them is another reason I bought these. These steps did the job! We will find out if they last over time. I was pleased with our purchase and didn’t really see anything else that would have worked as well as these. If it allows me to, I may take a picture and add to this review later. I recommend these steps!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: the right  one for me
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, well made, and solid. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lamike

customer_reviews.title: Snaps together and holds up!!
customer_reviews.text: So far these steps have held up 6 months in the winter through the heat of summer. They stay in place and accommodate a person of weight (275lb). Easy to hose off, fits flat against the tub exterior, color has not faded. Assembly was an easy “snap” together; absolutely no tools and no hardware!! Better than my old wooden steps.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest thing is making sure you know which way you want the steps to go. Curved or straight side toward the spa. Set them on and see how it looks before you attach them, otherwise, it's not coming back apart. But they are very durable steps and have been working out quite well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jonie Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great and 25% the cost of the Dealer
customer_reviews.text: They are stairs and they go together easily. My 10 year old daughter set it up. They look good, work as good as a step can work, and most importantly are about 25% the cost of what the spa dealer wanted to charge. Only issue is they might not work well for people over 250 lbs or so. I've noticed they start to flex when I stand on the top one, and I'm only 185 lbs. It's only a fraction of an inch, but it's there. No issue for us but others may want to know.
customer_reviews.author: TGSEA

customer_reviews.title: Unusual use
customer_reviews.text: My review is unusual because I bought these to use for my disabled husband to get into the car. Best thing we’ve found so far. It’s sturdy and the steps aren’t too high. Then I put them back in the car. We have an FJ Cruiser which is high and he had a lot of trouble before. These do the job
customer_reviews.author: Sher Doxzon

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected - works great!
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected and matches my hot tub perfectly. For those that say these step were made incorrectly regarding curved vs. flat fit next to a tub, they did not read the directions. These steps will work with a round or flat sided tub (see description AND diections).
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Simple But Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The steps arrived quickly. Instructions are on the outside of the box. Pay close attention to the shape of the two steps, they aren’t the same (but fit on either level). One is used on the top spot for round spas, the other for rectangular spas. The instructions say the steps snap in place and that you don’t need tools. Mine needed a nudge with a plastic mallet. If you put them on incorrectly, you probably won’t get them back off.
customer_reviews.author: Samuels83

customer_reviews.title: NOT EASY TO ASSEMBLE: SUPER HARD TO SNAP IT TOGETHER! WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN.
customer_reviews.text: Product comes with some propaganda for other items but with zero instructions inside. The box does have instructions/pictures, so hope for it arriving still legible! However, it does not require any brains to figure the assembly out but it requires a rubber hammer and a lot of muscles to snap it together! One has to pound REALLY hard and fore a long time for the pieces to snap. What worked at the end was pounding one snap in and just stepping really hard on the other snap. The snap parts are poorly designed! Like someone said, yes, you have to pound the daylight to get it assembled! This company should learn from IKEA.... Pieces fit together way easier...
customer_reviews.author: michael jordan

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Returns
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived and seems solid. However, the color was completely off. Rather than a brown "mahogany", it was a bright red/orange. I opted to return the item, but was told I would have to pay for shipping. Shipping the item back was roughly $70.00 so rather than losing most of my money, I opted to keep it and will paint it myself. The item appears to assemble fine, but the customer should be aware that they're on the hook for pricey shipping if they need to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice a bit hard to snap together
customer_reviews.text: It requires a strong guy or/and a heavy rubber mallet. Kinda hard to fit together but it does. It's fairly sturdy but no support in the center of the step so if you are very heavy not sure how sturdy it is. It looks nicer than my old crappy wooden steps
customer_reviews.author: cheryl brown

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and useful steps
customer_reviews.text: These seems very well made, like plastic playground equipment. Assembly is quick, but does require more force than you might expect. Key is to get the first pieces lined up. After that it goes fast. Once assembled, the steps are sturdy and very functional. Design is well thought out for both straight sided spa or round spa. Nice steps.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Geek

customer_reviews.title: Stairs snapped together very easily. I didn't have any issues at all
customer_reviews.text: Stairs snapped together very easily. I didn't have any issues at all. I think some people who mention difficulty putting it together aren't doing it correctly. You wedge a tab into the back of the slot and then press down on the front of the stairs and it pops right in. Color of the stairs is correct, and I stood on it, it seems solid. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them, but real pain to set up! It required two bottles of wine, which unfortunately weren't included.
customer_reviews.author: Chery C Carrico

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy, rugged and looks great in our RV doorway.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. It took maybe 10 minutes to put together in 95' F heat. It's sturdy, rugged and looks great in our RV doorway. My wife is 4'8" tall and was having trouble getting up and down the metal steps that came with the RV. Also, our dog is a Pug/Beagle mix with short legs and a barrel chest. Poor thing couldn't use the steps either. I had to pick him up each time which he really didn't like. So both my wife and our Puggle-dog are happy. So am I. I did need to use a rubber mallet to put it together, not a complaint. It just shows how sturdy this is. THANKS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked easy. To not heat up the one end [female] ...
customer_reviews.text: With no instructions for installation, I heated the top board inserts (step hole/slots) with a hair dryer to heat up the plastic to ease snapping each piece together. One person can do it. For snapping in place once it's almost in I used my steel toed boots to gently seat the plastic. It worked easy. To not heat up the one end [female] would be quite rough to seat. I had no trouble. 10 min tops.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M Eichenlaub

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice quality stairs, they are not light weight, chintzy or cheap feeling. The rounded edge step fit perfectly against our round tub. We were also happy to find out that they are Made in America (important to us) and manufactured by a family owned company (also important as I am self employed!). We would definitely recommend this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: melanie3kids

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price...
customer_reviews.text: These steps are well made, just a little tricky to assemble as it takes some muscle to snap the pieces together. I needed steps for a flat side to my hot tub. These accommodate both flat and round. I was a bit disappointed with the color "portabello" which was a taupe color, but 10 minutes with a can of spray paint fixed that!
customer_reviews.author: mwilson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase...satisfied
customer_reviews.text: What a great value for the money! Our hot tub bakes in the sun and the wooden steps we had for years were shot from sun damage. These steps were painless to assemble...we did read others who purchased the steps comment about assembly and found the tips more than helpful. The steps are sturdy and attractive. We hope they last for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: it does NOT snap together easily. I suggest assembling it in an air-conditioned room ...
customer_reviews.text: As some others have said, it does NOT snap together easily. I suggest assembling it in an air-conditioned room because it CAN be strenuous enough to work up a sweat, But once you succeed in getting it assembled, it is very sturdy,
customer_reviews.author: Kristan O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: A best buy!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these steps. They were super easy to put together all by myself (a 5'3" petite woman). They almost match my new hot tub exactly. The woman at the hot tub store recommended we go to Amazon instead of buying them in the store. They were about 1/4 of the ones in the store. LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: J. Russ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice simple but sturdy spa steps
customer_reviews.text: I got these after a frustrating purchase of the Confer Spa steps with storage. These took about 2 minutes and a rubber mallet hammer to put together, they are very sturdy, good sized and pleasantly match my spa perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jeana

customer_reviews.title: Fits great and I trust using it
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. Use it to replace our old hot tub steps that now serve as steps for our older dogs onto our bed. This could do either duty. Fits great and I trust using it. I am a pretty big guy and feel comfortable getting in and out of the hot tub using this product.
customer_reviews.author: HWildDragon

customer_reviews.title: Will save your knees
customer_reviews.text: Use it to go up and down an 18" WALL dividing two sections of my yard. Easy to step and down. The tread is wide and the rise is easy, especially when carrying garden tools, etc. Very well made and will be quite durable and able to withstand being out in New England winters. You will need a rubber mallet most likely as the rails and the step pieces are very tight to join- assemble, but that makes it very sturdy. Interesting family company from the enclosed product lit. Highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: E. Summerfelt

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble looks great a bit squeaky when you step on them however that is to expected they are plastic. No tools needed to assemble if you follow the directions. Perhaps a mallet would be good on the first step.
customer_reviews.author: 12th Street and Webb

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 400 gallon spa (indoors) and these steps work well. The height makes it easy to get in and the grooves are great at collecting water as I step out. Initially I thought about returning it because of how large it is (relative to my small tub) but I've grown to appreciate the safety I feel having something wide, long, and sturdy enough to support me. I chose this over others because of the price and I'm satisfied with the value.
customer_reviews.author: Shimone Samuel

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Handi-Step steps which replaced my old rotten wooden ones. Athough several reviews mentioned some difficulty assembling, I had no difficulty at all, as the pieces simply snapped into place (the trick is to angle it in). These steps are also adaptable to both straight and rounded sides making it versatile to different styles of spas or hot tubs. These steps are sturdy, and give a large enough surface area to step into or out of the tub, and the redwood color matches my tub, so you might think they came together. A durable and sturdy product of quality, I have been most pleased with my purchase. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Dave Russo

customer_reviews.title: Not the same color
customer_reviews.text: The steps are nice, but I ordered the portobello which is shown as a very dark brown. My stairs are light brown/grayish color.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper pool ladder alternative!
customer_reviews.text: We used it for our 10’ intex pool for my kids. It’s perfect for that! We put the rounded step on the top and it works like a charm. A much cheaper alternative to buying pool ladders!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Riley464

customer_reviews.title: My hubby was very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a quick solution for steps for our amish shop we had built and these definently fit the bill, especially for the price. Super easy to put together. My hubby is a large guy and they hold up just fine!! Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: sheenabeana

customer_reviews.title: Steps are a steady and non-slip way to get in and out of the spa.
customer_reviews.text: Steps are a steady, non-slippery,very attractive complement to our spa. I wanted steps that look like they belong with the spa. This step unit is a great color. It was so easy to put together as well. Just snap into place and apply a little bit of old lady pressure. The step unit affords a safer entry and climb out from our spa Than we had. I’m estremeky pleased. .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Sturdy, and Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: The four pieces of plastic that comprise this set of spa steps are easy to put together, and certainly meet the primary purpose of spa entry. The fact that it's made in the US shows we don't have to rely on China for all manufactured goods! I deducted a star only because it flexes a bit handling my 210 lbs. I'm not sure it would support more than that on a consistent basis. Additionally, we selected the Portabello color, which is not as dark as it appears on the web page. Certainly it isn't as dark as the color of our spa hot tub. Still, it's close enough and the darkest of the choices. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: winemac

customer_reviews.title: better instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give this a better review then I saw the other reviews by people on this product. If people keep putting it together wrong add a sticker, or make it so you can take it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Customer # 1

customer_reviews.title: Nice Step
customer_reviews.text: Nice step. My husband just stood on the pieces to snap them into place so no rubber mallet needed. Box said the max was 300 lbs but the weight capacity actually printed on the step says 350 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Red

customer_reviews.title: OK "but".
customer_reviews.text: Easy fix for wooden stairs, cheap too. Gray color matches our spa. It gives a little when you step on it, I'm not crazy about the feeling - esp. in wet feet. Now if you think you can put this together alone, you are wrong. It takes two, and one of you has to be strong! The finished product is worth the price, but keep all these "buts" in mind.
customer_reviews.author: ckgreenthumb

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase. larger than expected, but should have read closely. no problem. love that there are no screws or connectors to rust. we needed this to get into our hot tub. would purchase again. Wished the price was a bit lower though
customer_reviews.author: almondeyes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent step
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hot tub located at 5,000 foot elevation in the California mountains. It was easy to assemble. It is very sturdy. And has done well in four feet of snow as well as 90F summer days. A perfect replacement for the redwood step that was falling apart. And this should last forever.
customer_reviews.author: carlshome

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble ,but you must read the assembly directions very carefully.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is sturdy and stable. You must read the assembly directions carefully. The directions are clear. However, if you don't read the directions, it is possible to put this together incorrectly.
customer_reviews.author: bgnsvid

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble for a 230 lb guy with bare feet. Line up, stomp, with one foot. Just remember to match the profile of your tub (round/square) with the top step when assembling.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: when I was young I could hop right into my hot tub,,,,,,,,,,now it looks like a 6ft high jump.........steps are sturdy, easy to assemble and doesn't slip
customer_reviews.author: p.d.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.text: We needed steps to use for our hot tub. We've now had these steps for a few months, and we love them. I know other reviews mentioned they were difficult to assemble and flimsy, but my husband put these together in about two minutes with his bare hands-no tools. We find them to be plenty sturdy enough for our use. We highly recommend them, and we're extremely pleased with them. Edit: We've owned these for two and a half years now. Still love them! Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SavvyShopper

customer_reviews.title: The sturdiness of the spa step
customer_reviews.text: Thr product was very easily put together and it serves its' purpose. I use it even to sit on at times. This spa step is very sturdy and I weigh way too much (214). And yes I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Deyzvue

customer_reviews.title: BUY USA Products! Why buy from the showroom when you can save here?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Redwood Color:Color: Even and uniform. Redwood is nice for matching with brick patio or dark red spa base. I feel the color is slightly lighter than the picture on the web site. Assembly: Difficult with one person, snaps together and may need some force/counter force to construct. Quality: I give it an 8/10. The step is sturdy enough for a 200 pound person or less. I was able to bounce on the top without any concern of breaking the top step. Pros: Low price, good construction, even color. Cons: Not the best quality available, difficult to assembly. Overall I recommend this for someone not wanting to overpay for something that sits on the ground and helps you get in and
customer_reviews.author: Doc Kane

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE SERVICE COLOR COMPLETELY DIFFERENT THAN IN PICTURE
customer_reviews.text: COLOR TOTALLY DID NOT MATCH PICTURE. RETURN REQUEST APPROVED AND RETURNED. SELLER ACKNOWLEDGED RETURN THEN KEPT ASKING FOR PICS OF THE PRODUCT WHICH I ALREADY RETURNED. I EXPLAINED THAT I DID NOT EVEN TAKE OUT OF BOX. I RETURNED AND THEY ACKNOWLEDGED RETURN. YET THEY KEEP ASKING FOR PHOTO OF THE RETURNED ITEM AND REFUSE TO GIVE ME REFUND!!!!! THIS HAS BEEN GOING ON FOR MONTHS!!!! THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE FOR THIS BEHAVIOR!!! 100% HORRIBLE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aglaia Antoniadis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: It basically pounds right into place installation is very easy you just have to pop in the top of the stepa, rotate downward and give it a good bang it pops right into place. Won't rust, rot and can clearly hold s good amount of weight. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Thomas The tank engine

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, great color and easy assembly with a rubber mallet.
customer_reviews.text: We are using these steps for our hot tub. I love how sturdy they are. My husband and I are a heavier couple and these do not give way. I love the color ; it matches the cover perfectly. Only thing Is they slide a bit when stepping out onto them or I would have given them a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Great for my RV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my RV, it is sturdy, steps are a good size and distance apart. The steps on my RV had too much distance between them. I removed them and this solved my problem. I like it
customer_reviews.author: bruce Palus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Step
customer_reviews.text: We bought this rather than buying it from the spa retailer which was twice the cost. Step was easy to assemble & matches great with our spa.
customer_reviews.author: Hoppy

customer_reviews.title: Used for Semi - In Ground Pool
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something to get in and out of pool.. I have a semi in ground pool and we have not built a deck yet. This works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Xenios

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased these steps to use with our older motorhome when it is parked at my home. It's also use as "guest quarters" when a lot of friends and family stay over. The "built in" steps are small and steep and some older family members struggle with them. These steps worked out great for us. They are wide, stable and a weather resistant material. They could be a bit stiffer, but they should hold up well for average sized user.
customer_reviews.author: JunkyJoe

customer_reviews.title: Returns are a ripoff
customer_reviews.text: This was not what I expected and needed to return They charged me $19.04 for return. Make sure you really want this or it'll cost you !!!
customer_reviews.author: francesca simonton

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Spas
customer_reviews.text: These work perfect for my application. I am using them as steps for a travel trailer. My son has severe brain injury. He can walk, but has some problems, and is partially blind. These steps are way easier for him to navigate than the steps built in on the trailer. They also are easier on my mom's arthritic hips and legs when she joins us on camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Calichigal

customer_reviews.title: High quality!
customer_reviews.text: Look great, perform great! Used these for standing behind a dance photo prop--wow worked great for "quick" stair need and easy to store for future! Would be terrific for hot tub stair too!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: No instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but 4 stars because they’re shipping this w/o instructions. Had to read reviews with tips on how others put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Be careful - doesn't stay put!
customer_reviews.text: NOT SAFE! The first time I tried to step out of my hot tub onto this, it slid away from the hot tub and I found myself doing the splits. Maybe if you found a way to nail it down?
customer_reviews.author: Lake Gal

customer_reviews.title: READ THE BOX FOR ASSEMBLY TO FIT YOUR TUB
customer_reviews.text: The Box even had assembly options for round or square tubs. One reveiwer clearly did not read the box as they complained that the square edge top step did not work on their round tub. We assembled correctly and it works great---READ THE BOX
customer_reviews.author: Judi Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice replacement for original wood. Let's see how it holds up in sub zero temperatures. Plastic can become brittle. Hope not here. Note: takes two to assemble. Don't be afraid to stomp on it hard!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Poor description
customer_reviews.text: I need steps inside a deep spa/ hot tub. These float and won’t work in water. Must return.
customer_reviews.author: JoanInKC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Snaps together easily- I laid part aligned with slot and used my rubber mallet to snap together. No movement after assembly nn
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN V.

customer_reviews.title: Spa step that does the job and is inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought the step with some reservations that it might be too cheap given the price. I was surprised by the quality and I'm very happy with my purchase. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Assembly even easier if you follow confer's video assembly intructions!
customer_reviews.text: I struggled to assemble this product (got one side in but not the other) until I called Confer. Their customer service is amazing, I reached a capable, helpful, polite person immediately who sent me the assembly video (I tried to upload here with no luck) . Must admit, I felt a bit silly after watching it but it does make the assembly incredibly simple. Its a place and stomp. Forget the box instructions , just line up the step and stomp (hard) on each corner, hard! Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Hot tub steps.
customer_reviews.text: This was a must have, but the price is a bit high. But we needed it real bad for hot tub. Sturdy and non slip.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: It is great. Strong
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to put by our trampoline for our grandchildren to be able to get on. It is great. Strong, weather resistant, and the perfect size. We have bought one for the hot tub also and it seems to be so very durable. We are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: CMD

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These steps are well worth the money. We have a Jacuzzi hot tub, and the local store wanted $189 for a similar set of steps. They install 2 ways. You can put the curved part in the front or in the back. Getting the steps set into the plastic sides can be a pain. I used a rubber mallet and tapped them into place. They are made of durable plastic, and feel very solid.
customer_reviews.author: genobpgh

customer_reviews.title: The normal trailer steps are just not sturdy enough. I saw the idea of buying the ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our camping trailer. The normal trailer steps are just not sturdy enough. I saw the idea of buying the spa steps on Pinterest and so these fit the bill. They are sturdy and very easy to clean. Plus they are wide enough to make you feel comfortable getting in and out of the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to put together, it just snaps together. Tested the weight limit since we were concerned with guests using it, and can confirm as long as its put together correctly, it can take more than its recommended limit. Looks great against the hot tub, easy to keep clean and the perfect height.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Borchers

customer_reviews.title: Confer HS2MR 29"x23"x14" Handi-Step for Round/Straight Sided Spa - Medium Red
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for my hot tub. Its wide and sturdy and was very easy for me to put together. I did not have any slipping problems like some did but that might just be the tile it is on. Good buy and good price. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Works well with our Amazon Spa
customer_reviews.text: Just the perfect size for this Spa that is an Octagon. Is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley D Nordlund

customer_reviews.title: I put these steps by my bed so my blind ...
customer_reviews.text: I put these steps by my bed so my blind 8 pound dog can climb onto the bed. The steps are wide, study, and work perfectly for her. They are well made, study and durable. I found one has to be strong to put them together but once they are together they are going to stay that way.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Loesch

customer_reviews.title: These steps are great. I don't know why previous reviews claimed these ...
customer_reviews.text: These steps are great. I don't know why previous reviews claimed these were hard to assemble. Picture instructions are on the outside of the box. Just guide one side under the protrusion on the side supports and then stomp on the other side with your foot to snap it in place. Took me literally 10 seconds. Don't mess around with mallets.
customer_reviews.author: L. Karman

customer_reviews.title: Light yet durable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This step is perfect for the spa. I like the traction grooves and the openings where you can slip flip flops underneath and they are very easy to put together. They are very light so its easy to move them around if you needed too.
customer_reviews.author: Parrothead

customer_reviews.title: Pairs well with the Bestway Helsinki Saluspa
customer_reviews.text: Pairs well with the Bestway Helsinki Saluspa. Don't be afraid to use force when assembling, you're going to need to.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

product_meta.title: Confer HS2MR 29"x23"x14" Handi-Step for Round/Straight Sided Spa - Medium Red
product_meta.description: Color:Redwood ColorConfer Plastics Handi Step HS2 is a completely redesigned spa step which was created with durability and versatility in mind. The new HS 2 Handi-Step incorporates the ability to use the step with a straight-sided spa or a rounded spa. Construction is literally just a few snaps and you have a beautiful step for your spa.
feature_bullets: Cleans easily with soap and water

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,375 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
